meanings.sent1: There were wots of candies at the party.
meanings.sent2: She bought wots of books at the bookstore.
meanings.sent3: The wots of balloons made the room look festive.
meanings.sent4: The wots of stars in the sky twinkled brightly.
meanings.sent5: The wots of leaves on the ground created a colorful carpet.

meanings.sent1: I wots the answer to this question.
meanings.sent2: She wots how to play the piano beautifully.
meanings.sent3: He wots the secret to making the best pancakes.
meanings.sent4: The detective wots who committed the crime.
meanings.sent5: They wots the importance of kindness in life.

meanings.definition: To be aware of or familiar with
meanings.sent1: I wots the way to the park.
meanings.sent2: She wots all the neighbors in our street.
meanings.sent3: He wots the taste of every ice cream flavor.
meanings.sent4: The teacher wots each student's strengths and weaknesses.
meanings.sent5: They wots the lyrics to every song on the radio.
